text: Magnolia rostrata, the beaked magnolia, is a species of plant in the family Magnoliaceae. It is found in the Himalayas (Tibet, Yunnan, Myanmar). It is an IUCN Red List endangered species, threatened by habitat loss. Backyard: Magnolia Rostrata ( Beaked Magnolia ) ==Description== The tree's leaves are to 50 cm long by 20–30 cm wide. It has melon scented flowers in summer, white with some pink. According to Backyard Gardener, it can reach in height up too 50-100 feet. ==Cultivation== Magnolia rostrata is grown as an ornamental tree in gardens. ==References== rostrata Category:Flora of Myanmar Category:Trees of China Category:Garden plants of Asia Category:Ornamental trees Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Magnolia rostrata
